definitions.definition: The sound made by an object hitting a liquid.
definitions.example: I heard a splash when the rock landed in the pond.
I felt a splash of rain, so I put up my hood.
The painter put a splash of blue on the wall to make it more colorful

definitions.definition: A mark or stain made from a small amount of liquid.
definitions.example: There was a visible splash on his pants after he went to the bathroom.
The new movie made quite a splash upon its release.

definitions.definition: A body press; a move where the wrestler jumps forward from a raised platform such as the top turnbuckle, landing stomach first across an opponent lying on the ground below.
A cosmetic powder for the complexion.
To hit or agitate liquid so that part of it separates from the principal liquid mass.
definitions.example: sit and splash in the bathtub

definitions.definition: To disperse a fluid suddenly; to splatter.
To hit or expel liquid at
definitions.example: The children were splashing each other playfully in the sea.

definitions.definition: To create an impact or impression; to print, post or publicize prominently.
definitions.example: The headline was splashed across newspapers everywhere.
After pay day I can afford to splash some cash and buy myself a motorbike.

definitions.definition: To stab (a person), causing them to bleed.
